thread.title: Proton needs new strategic partnership, says Najib
thread.title_full: Proton needs new strategic partnership, says Najib - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: Proton needs new strategic partnership, says Najib

persons.name: datuk seri dr salleh said keruak

text:
PEKAN: National car manufactu­rer Proton must look for a strategic partner but this does not mean the company is being sold to foreigners, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak.
“This (finding a partner) is so there will be an injection of new technology and a larger market. 
“When there is a larger volume of sales, there will be more jobs in Pekan and Tanjung Malim. 
“The people are the ones who will benefit from this.
“We do not play using emotions and fake news. We do what is best for the people,” said Najib.
He added that a former leader had committed many mistakes in the handling of Proton. 
“I do not want to talk about it, but we want to fix it,” Najib said at the opening of the Negaraku: Komuniti 1Malaysia programme yesterday.
In his speech, he said fake news was a great threat to society and an all-out war must be waged against false information, propaganda and slander.
He said the Government had done many good things and yet these were always twisted into controversial issues through fake news.
He said this fake news was being spread through social media and by certain leaders with the political purpose of toppling the Govern­ment.
Najib said that as proposed by Communications and Multimedia Minister Datuk Seri Dr Salleh Said Keruak, the war cry for this would be “Siap! (Ready!)”.
“It means ready to receive orders from leaders. Orders must be obeyed.
“Don’t let orders enter your right ear only to exit the left,” he reminded the crowd during the programme held at Taman Tasik Sultan Abu Bakar here.
Najib also took potshots at a former leader, saying that the leader had opposed, supported then opposed the 1Malaysia People’s Aid (BR1M) again in the span of three months.
“When you are not consistent, have different intentions and is not guided by truth, then this is just playing politics with the motive of toppling the Government. In the end, the people will see through your bluff.
“He said we are giving citizenship to mainland Chinese who purchase homes in Johor when we have never even discussed this in the Cabinet,” he said.
Najib added that he had been accused of selling away the sove­reignty of Malaysia to China when he had merely wanted to get more investments for the country.
“King Salman is visiting us. What are they going to say? That we are selling our sovereignty to Saudi Arabia now? 
“People are here to invest so our economy can grow and more jobs can be created for Malaysians,” he said.
